title: Salt Fat Acid Heat
description: Chef and food writer Samin Nosrat travels the world to explore four basic keys to wonderful cooking, serving up feasts and helpful tips along the way.

title: Sample This
description: This doc traces the impact of the Incredible Bongo Band's "Apache," which played a key role in the birth of hip-hop after Kool Herc began sampling it.

title: Saudi Arabia Uncovered
description: Undercover cameras expose public floggings, executions and other brutality in Saudi Arabia, and introduce those risking their own lives for change.

title: Saving Banksy
description: Focusing on unauthorized sellers of graffiti artist Banksy's work, this film examines the conflicting philosophies of street art and profiteering.

title: Saving Capitalism
description: Former Secretary of Labor Robert Reich meets with Americans from all walks of life as he chronicles a seismic shift in the nation's economy.

title: Scam City
description: Author and TV personality Conor Woodman travels to the world's most-visited cities, exposing tourist scams by purposely falling victim to them.

title: Secrets of Scotland Yard
description: Revisit famous cases and explore the history of Scotland Yard, one of the world's oldest detective forces and a name synonymous with crime solving.

title: Secrets of Selfridges
description: American Harry Gordon Selfridge introduced Londoners to a new retail model that made shopping less of a practical pursuit and more of an adventure.

title: Secrets of the Shroud
description: Travel from holy Mount Athos in Greece to the city of Oviedo in Spain to investigate whether the revered Shroud of Turin is authentic or counterfeit.

title: Secrets of the Solar System
description: This documentary examines the advances in astronomy and data from other stars and planets that are reshaping scientists' view of our solar system.

title: Secrets of the Tower of London
description: Explore the storied history of the iconic Tower of London as it evolved from a royal castle into a dungeon prison and, finally, an armory and mint.

title: Seeing Allred
description: Explore the public and private sides of feminist firebrand attorney Gloria Allred, who's battled some of the biggest names in politics and business.

title: Shadow Trade
description: This harrowing documentary sheds light on a largely mysterious practice occurring in the criminal underworld of Thailand: the illegal dog meat trade.

title: She Makes Comics
description: Often forgotten or ignored, women creators have a rich history of achievement in comic books, a business and culture where some gender biases persist.

title: She's Beautiful When She's Angry
description: An inspiring look at the brilliant, outrageous women who spearheaded the 1960s women's movement resonates with those who still face gender inequality.

title: Shirkers
description: In 1992, Sandi Tan and her friends shot a quirky film on the streets of Singapore. Then the footage disappeared, sending her on a hunt for answers.

title: SHOT! The Psycho-Spiritual Mantra of Rock
description: Aptly named iconic rock photographer Mick Rock reconstructs his journey through the thrilling and murky universe of rock 'n' roll history.

title: Shut-ins: Britain's Fattest People
description: A man and a woman confined indoors because of their weight seek specialists' help to overcome their eating addictions and turn their lives around.

title: Silicon Cowboys
description: This documentary tells the story of Compaq Computer and its three founders, who in 1982, took on Goliath IBM at the height of its PC dominance.

title: Sky Ladder: The Art of Cai Guo-Qiang
description: Known for his spectacular pyrotechnic displays, Chinese artist Cai Guo-Qiang creates his most ambitious project yet in this breathtaking documentary.

title: Sleepwalkers Who Kill
description: This documentary takes a serious look at a rare medical and legal condition that has turned ordinary people who sleepwalk into unwitting killers.

title: Sneakerheadz
description: Athletes, rappers and other sneaker fanatics show off their sprawling collections as experts trace the evolution of a pop culture phenomenon.

title: Social Fabric
description: Clothing designer Kyle Ng takes viewers on a series of eye-opening quests to learn about streetwear staples and fashion trends around the world.

title: Somebody Feed Phil
description: "Everybody Loves Raymond" creator Phil Rosenthal travels the globe to take in the local cuisine and culture of Bangkok, Lisbon, Mexico City and more.

title: Something Ventured
description: A look at the world's most revolutionary companies, such as Apple, Intel and Genentech, and how they emerged through American venture capitalism.

title: Somm
description: Four sommeliers embark on an all-consuming course of study for the prestigious (and nearly impossible to pass) Master Sommelier exam.

title: Somm: Into the Bottle
description: Expert winemakers and sommeliers delve into the mysteries surrounding wine, from its delicious and colorful history to how it's made and marketed.

title: Sour Grapes
description: A dizzying chronicle of excess and deception dissects a fascinating case of fine-wine fraud and the con man who cheated investors out of millions.

title: Sports Adventure
description: Climbers, skiers, kayakers, surfers and other sports enthusiasts are out to challenge the ultimate competitor: Mother Nature.

title: Spy Who Went Into the Cold
description: Learn the true story of Kim Philby, a senior official at MI6 whose 1963 defection to Moscow exposed his 30-year career as a spy for the Soviet Union.

title: Star Men
description: British astronomers who worked on the NASA moon-landing project reunite for an American road trip, celebrating 50 years of friendship and achievement.

title: Starboard Light
description: As a family prepares to reluctantly sell the Cape Cod cottage they have owned for generations, a documentary filmmaker chronicles their sense of loss.

title: Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine
description: This unflinching documentary examines the exacting work environment created by Apple's mercurial CEO and his cultlike influence on technology culture.

title: Stink!
description: After noting a strange odor in his child’s pajamas, a single dad’s search for the source uncovers potentially toxic secrets of the chemical industry.

title: Stray Bullet
description: In 2014,12-year-old Genesis Rincon was fatally shot while riding her scooter. Those linked to the tragedy reflect on justice and the cycle of violence.

title: Street Fight
description: This unflinching documentary follows upstart politician Cory Booker as he tries to unseat the incumbent in the 2002 mayoral election in Newark, N.J.

title: Stretch and Bobbito: Radio That Changed Lives
description: This documentary focuses on the origins and popularity of New York radio hosts Stretch and Bobbito, who opened up the world to hip-hop in the 1990s.

title: Strong Island
description: The forces of family, grief and racial injustice converge in this Oscar-nominated documentary exploring the murder of filmmaker Yance Ford's brother.

title: Sufi Soul: The Mystic Music of Islam
description: Learn about the connection between the musical and the mystical as historian William Dalrymple explores the singing and dancing central to Sufism.

title: Survivors Guide to Prison
description: Former inmates, officers and celebrities critique the U.S. prison system in this documentary packaged as a how-to handbook for the incarcerated.

title: Sustainable
description: Chef Rick Bayless, farmers and others discuss the history leading to the sustainable food movement and how it could change what we eat in the future.
